definition: mutual repulsion (e.g. electrostatic)/to repel one another
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to blame/to reprove/to reprimand/to expel/to oust/to reconnoiter/(of territory) to expand/saline marsh
like polarities repel each other/(fig.) like repels like

sentences.english: Living for ministry and living for money are mutually exclusive goals. Which one will you choose?
sentences.chinese: 爲錢而活與爲事工而活是相斥的目標，你要選哪一個？

sentences.english: Like charges repel, but opposite charges attract, which is one of the fundamental laws of electricity.
sentences.chinese: 電荷同性相斥，異性相吸，這是電的一個基本規律。

sentences.english: So, most of the time they repel.
sentences.chinese: 因此，它們大多時候是相斥的。

sentences.english: Wang started to be a grouch.
sentences.chinese: 小王開始對所有的事怒目相斥。

sentences.english: Because atoms with the same charge repel.
sentences.chinese: 由於帶同性電的原子會相斥。

sentences.english: Two negative charges repel each other, and so do two positive charges.
sentences.chinese: 兩個負電荷相斥，每個正電荷也是如此。

definition: mutual attraction (e.g. electrostatic)/to attract one another
like polarities repel each other/(fig.) like repels like
opposite polarities attract/(fig.) opposite sexes attract/opposites attract
the two poles/the north and south poles/both ends of sth/electric or magnetic poles
